SENT.plain: Capillary malformations are common vascular malformations
Several syndromes have been described in which CMs are present in association with limb enlargement, among these are Klippel-Trenaunay syndrome (KTS) and Parkes Weber syndrome (PWS)
Mutations in the RASA1 gene have been shown to underlie the capillary malformation-arterio-venous malformation (CM-AVM) syndrome, sometimes presenting with PWS
We identified a family comprising a patient with CMs and limb enlargement and a number of family members with CM/CM-AVM
A novel mutation in RASA1 was found to underlie the disease in this case
The present results illustrate the extensive degree of phenotypic heterogeneity associated with deleterious mutations in RASA1
